content:
# List of intents:
[
    {
        "intentId": "Dev7643",
        "intentName": "PrintDeviceIssuesSupport",
        "intentDescription": " Any issues with printers, scanners, copiers and faxes only. Does not include any issues with laptop or other devices .",
        "slots": [
            {
                "slotId": "EmC301912",
                "slotName": "IssueType",
                "slot_description": "represents the type of issue the user is experiencing.",
                "type": "String ",
                "possible_Values": [
                    "PaperJams",
                    "PoorPrintQuality",
                    "ConnectionIssues",
                ],
            },
            {
                "slotId": "EmC30341",
                "slotName": "DeviceBrand",
                "slot_description": "refers to the company or manufacturer that produces the device ",
                "type": "String ",
                "possible_Values": [
                    "Dell",
                    "HP",
                    "Epson",
                ]
            },
            {
                "slotId": "DeMo4782",
                "slotName": "DeviceModel",
                "slot_description": "a type or design of a device that manufacturers typically release in a series.",
                "type": "String "
            }
        ]
    },
    {
        "intentId": " HW095r94",
        "intentName": "HardwareRequest",
        "intentDescription": "Requests for a new piece of hardware (physical devices). To be used only if there is an explicit request for hardware present, not if a user just says a piece of hardware doesn't work. ",
        "slots": [
            {
                "slotId": "hWty080934",
                "slotName": "HardWareType",
                "slot_description": "refers to the physical components of a computer system or electronic device. These tangible parts can be seen and touched, and they work together to enable the device to function",
                "type": "String ",
                "possible_Values": [
                    "mouse",
                    "cable",
                    "laptop",
                    "phone",
                    "motherboard",
                    "USB",
                    "keyboards",
                    "monitor",
                    "printer",
                    "scanner",
                    "headphones"
                ]
            },
            {
                "slotId": "hwNa0155",
                "slotName": "HardWareBrand",
                "slot_description": "refers to the company or manufacturer that produces physical components or devices, often related to technology and electronics.",
                "type": "String "
            },
            {
                "slotId": "hwMo5434",
                "slotName": "HardWareModel",
                "slot_description": "a specific version or configuration of a physical device or component produced by a manufacturer. It is a unique identifier that distinguishes one variant of hardware from another within a product line.",
                "type": "String "
            }
        ]
    },
    {
        "intentId": "CIq57930",
        "intentName": "ConcurInquiry",
        "intentDescription": "User has an inquiry or concern about the Concur system. ",
        "slots": [
            {
                "slotId": "InT739049",
                "slotName": "InquiryType",
                "slot_description": "rSpecifies the type of inquiry or concern the user has within the Concur system.",
                "type": "String ",
                "possible_Values": [
                    "SystemConcern",
                    "TravelExpensing",
                    "BusinessPurchases",
                    "TravelBooking",
                    "ExpenseReports"
                ]
            },
            {
                "slotId": "EXCat4792",
                "slotName": "ExpenseCategory",
                "slot_description": "If the inquiry is related to expensing travel costs or business purchases, this slot specifies the relevant category.",
                "type": "String ",
                "possible_Values": [
                    "TravelCosts",
                    "BusinessPurchases"
                ]
            },
            {
                "slotId": "TrBo00023",
                "slotName": "TravelBooking",
                "slot_description": "this slot specifies the type of travel being booked, if the inquiry involves booking business travel ",
                "type": "String ",
                "possible_Values": [
                    "Flight",
                    "Hotel",
                    "CarRental",
                    "Other"
                ]
            }
        ]
    },
    {
            "intentId": "NA89302bfh",
            "intentName": "None_of_the_Above",
            "intentDescription": "typically indicates that the correct answer or option is not included in the provided other choices. "
    }
 ]

You'll be provided with a list of intents in json format. 
For each intent there are also slots associated with them.  Slots are values that need to be retrieved for a particular intent.  Each slot will have a name, datatype, and description.  It may also include a field possibleValues which means the slot must match one of the provided values.

Please go through the Information and classify the utterance you'll be provided. Extract all the relevant slots if applicable.

Give your output as a JSON.  The JSON should always have a key “output”.  Important: The value of “output” should be a dictionary where the key of this dictionary is the intent id and the values is a sub-dictionary where the keys are the slot ids associated with the given intent and the values are the slot values. Ignore all slots from the utterance that are not specified in the list of intents and their slots provided.  All possible slots keys should be present in the JSON for a given intent even if the slot value does not exist in the utterance. 
Important: the utterance should accurately match the intent description. 
 


Utterance:

Recently, I purchased a new LG gram 14” 16:10 WUXGA IPS Ultra-Lightweight Laptop, and I am having issues the built-in camera after the power outage three days ago. Whenever I try to use it for video calls or taking pictures, it doesn't seem to work properly. I have checked the settings, but I am unable to identify the problem.
Considering the importance of video calls for my work and personal life, it's crucial for me to have the camera functioning as soon as possible. I would greatly appreciate your guidance and support in resolving this matter till tomorrow 3:00 pm. I don't want a new device. I want to troubleshoot my LG laptop asap.
